This one does much better.

Also Chalomet is kind of annoying compared to Kyle MachLachlan.
Vaguely related, Edna Mode has to be based off of Linda Hunt, who played Shadout Mapes, and omg, I didn't know that Si√¢n Phillips was also Cassiopeia in Clash of the Titans, but it makes perfect sense now.

author: @willard39
text: I love the books (even his son's...I know, I'm insane), just like I loved the LOTR books, and the movies did an amazing job adapting them. Same for the first installment - amazing adaptation. I'm not looking for a word for word adaptation. It just has to nail the essence of the story - mission accomplished so far, as I haven't see P2 yet. It would be very surprising to me, given how much I loved P1, that I wouldn't love this too. This is where all the incredible lead-up leads up to. Unless they completely re-write and fuck up the denouement or fire the FX guys and replaced them with apes, pretty hard to drop the Fremen here.

author: @3choblast3r4
text:
I am 90% sure I will enjoy this movie. I'm 99% sure I would have enjoyed it more if I wasn't a dune fan. I love Villeneuve's movies, but it looks like Dennis changed a lot for this movie. And not for the better. Why the f would you make Chani the protagonist. Why would you make her doubt the prophecy. It's so dumb, it's clearly only done because of the people who don't know anything about Dune and assumed it's a "white saviour movie." If you wanted to have some Fremen doubt the Atreides and the Prophecy, to set up the next movie. That's fine. That's a change I can live with. But Chani? That's a terrible person for that role.

Oh... yeah, I will probably definitely be someone who will be very disappointed after seeing this movie (I hope not). Since even Jeremy's review he talks about all the people who were complaining and talking about the changes from the books. It's *SO uneccesary, the books are incredibly good and the first movie was pretty faithfully adapted from the first half of the book, what possesed these people to make Chani the protagnist and change the story ffs, can't we EVER have a good adaptation of something*

p.s. as a bald man I take offense at the Harkonens all being bald. I wish they kept proper easthetic for Feyd. But I also wish they kept the baron a pederast. It's just part of the story and a good way to demonstrate how depraved he is.
